definition: Hunan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
abbr. for Hunan 湖南 province in south central China/abbr. for Xiangjiang river in Hunan province
variant of 繡|绣[xiu4]
to embroider/embroidery

sentences.english: Xiang Embroidery gained popularity day by day.
sentences.chinese: 湘绣赢得了声望与日俱增。

sentences.english: Xiang embroidery has a long history and can be dated to the Spring and Autumn Warring States Period more than two thousands years ago.
sentences.chinese: 湘绣历史悠久，可追溯到二千多年前的春秋战国时期。

sentences.english: Xiang Embroidery is famous for its rich colors.
sentences.chinese: 湘绣以其华丽的颜色而闻名。

sentences.english: Xiang embroidery is famous with embroider tiger.
The most persuasive evidence of Xiang Embroidery is the articles unearthed in Mawangdui Han Tomb.
sentences.chinese: 在湘绣最有说服力的证据是第马王堆汉墓中出土。

definition: Guangdong embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
Suzhou embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
Sichuan embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 蘇繡|苏绣[Su1 xiu4], 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4] and 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4])
batik (color printing on cloth using wax)
woven palm fiber (used in handicraft)/coir/woven coconut fiber
kesi or k’o-ssu, Chinese silk tapestry woven in a pictorial design
brocade from Sichuan
to embroider/embroidery
brocade/silk fabric with colored pattern
Nü Shu writing, a phonetic syllabary for Yao ethnic group 瑶族 瑤族 dialect designed and used by women in Jiangyong county 江永縣|江永县 in southern Hunan
embroidery
Xiang opera (Hunan)
applied art
Changde sixian, theatrical folk music style with singing in Changde dialect accompanied by traditional string instruments
papercutting (Chinese folk art)/to make paper cutouts
handicraft/arts and crafts
